title: Brenig Way Walking Route

images.title: Pont Corwen by Oliver Dixon, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Pont Corwen. This riverside town marks the start point for the walk.

images.title: Eirian Evans / Pont Dyfrdwy, Cynwyd
images.caption: Pont Dyfrdwy, Cynwyd. Four arched bridge over the river Dee at Cynwyd, near Corwen.

images.title: Eirian Evans / River Corris flowing into the Clywedog.
images.caption: River Corris flowing into the Clywedog at Cyffylliog.

images.title: Ysgol Bettws Gwerfil Goch by John Haynes, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Ysgol Bettws Gwerfil Goch

images.title: Dot Potter / Forestry and Llyn Brenig
images.caption: Forestry and Llyn Brenig. Forestry commission land and Llyn Brenig taken from near Bryn y Gors Goch.

description: Follow the Brenig Way way from Corwen, in the Dee Valley, to the beautiful Llyn Brenig, in the heart of the Denbigh Moors. The walk passes through Cynwyd, Maerdy and Betws Gwerfil Goch, before following the River Clwyd towards Clocaenog Forest where there are fabulous views of the Clwydian Range AONB. At Cyffylliog you then join the River Clywedog leading you to Llyn Brenig where you follow the shoreline to the finish point at the visitor centre. The final section has fabulous views of Snowdonia and also crosses the Brenig dam.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: At the start/finish point in Corwen the Crown Hotel is worthy of some investigation. The historic inn dates all the way back to 1628. The interior is full of olde worlde character with interesting features including pewter tankards hanging from the ceiling. They serve good food and are designated as a Camra Welsh Heritage pub. There's also a snooker table upstairs. You can find them on Bridge Street at postcode LL21 0AH.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: The Dee Valley also starts in Corwen. The 15 mile trail will take you east to Llangollen on a challenging waymarked trail.

display_address: Corwen Post Office, The Square, Corwen, Denbighshire, Cymru / Wales, LL21 0DF, United Kingdom
